column2: UTAH PERMIT TEST
column4: Utah
column6: UT

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column6: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column8: Near school zones.
column10: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead; slow down to the indicated speed
column6: The road ahead curves right; slow down to indicated speed
column8: Merge, then slow down to the safe speed indicated
column10: Divided highway begins. Slow down to the safe speed indicated

column2: 3. When you see this sign you should:
column4: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column6: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column8: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column10: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column6: Yield right-of-way to bicycles
column8: Bicycle parking ahead
column10: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic

column2: 5. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column6: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.
column8: always park on the left side of the roadway.

column2: 6. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Listen to heavy metal music.
column6: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column8: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

column2: 7. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column6: Return gestures and shouts.
column8: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.

column2: 8. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column6: Rounabout ahead.
column8: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column10: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: Pass only in the right lane
column6: Cars in right lane must slow down
column8: No left turn

column2: 10. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
column6: call the fire department immediately.
column8: remove yourself before it starts to sink.

column2: 11. When other drivers around you are acting in anger, you should:
column4: distance yourself from the situation.
column6: avoid making eye contact.
column8: slow down or move over safely.

column2: 12. If your wheels drop off the pavement onto the shoulder of the road, you should:
column4: maintain your current speed and turn onto the pavement.
column6: slow down and carefully turn back onto the pavement.
column8: stop your car on the side of the road.
column10: immediately come to a complete stop, then quickly turn back onto the pavement.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway
column6: No parking
column8: Yield

column2: 14. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
column6: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column8: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.

column2: 15. If the traffic lights are out of service when you approach an intersection, you:
column4: must slow down and yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column6: must proceed with caution.
column8: must continue according to the rules of right-of-way.
column10: must come to a stop as you would for a stop sign.

column2: 16. When changing lanes, you can check your blind spot by:
column4: turning your head and glancing over your shoulder.
column6: checking the rearview and outside mirrors.
column8: using the inside rearview mirror.

column2: 17. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column6: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
column8: signal.

column2: 18. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column6: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.
column8: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column10: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.

column2: 19. When entering an interstate highway, you:
column4: must wait for an opening in traffic on the entrance ramp.
column6: have the right of way.
column8: must yield to drivers already on the interstate.
column10: you must wait for the full lane to be clear.

column2: 20. Drivers should use the horn:
column4: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.
column6: when feeling angry or upset.
column8: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.
column10: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.

column2: 21. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.
column6: you may stop to let out passengers.
column8: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.
column10: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.

column2: 22. You can pass on the right:
column4: when passing is restricted by parked cars.
column6: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column8: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column10: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.

column2: 23. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
column6: U-turns are not allowed.
column8: they must not make a right turn.

column2: 24. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
25. After stopping for a school bus that is unloading children you should:
column4: watch for children walking along the side of the road.
column6: wait at least 4 minutes.
column8: put on your emergency flashers.
